Title: Google announces a new protocol to facilitate commerce using AI agents
Summary: Google has announced a new AI commerce protocol allowing merchants to offer discounts directly in AI search results, while Meta is expanding its green energy footprint by signing power deals with three nuclear companies. In tech news from CES 2026, major players like Nvidia and AMD are showcasing new chips, and Wing is set to expand its drone delivery service to over 270 Walmart stores by 2027.

Title: Luminar lines up $22 million bidder for its lidar business
Summary: Tech startup Luminar is fielding a $22 million bid for its lidar business, while French defense tech company Harmattan AI has raised $200 million and become a unicorn after investment from Dassault Aviation. In other news, Meta has hired former Trump advisor Dina Powell McCormick as president and vice chair, marking another significant leadership change in big tech.

Title: OpenAI's new reasoning model can explain its thoughts
Summary: OpenAI released o3-mini, its latest reasoning model that can explain its step-by-step thinking process. The model shows significant improvements in complex problem-solving tasks while being more cost-effective than previous versions, marking a major advance in interpretable AI systems.

Title: Apple Vision Pro gets major spatial computing update
Summary: Apple announced a significant software update for Vision Pro, introducing new spatial computing features including improved hand tracking, collaborative virtual workspaces, and enhanced integration with Mac. The update aims to position Vision Pro as a serious productivity tool beyond entertainment, with several enterprise partnerships announced.
